title: Gérard Bertrand 2013 Syrah-Grenache (Languedoc)
description: Rich scents of blackcurrant liqueur, raspberry sauce and boysenberry lead the nose of this seductive wine, with additional hints of black pepper and charred spice adding depth. The mouthfeel is full and creamy, while medium tannins lend enough texture and grip to frame the full-flavored fruit character.

title: Gershon Bachus 2013 Euphros De Portola Trail Vineyard White (Temecula)
description: An intriguing blend of 40% Pinot Grigio, 40% Vermentino and 20% Viognier, this shows rounded nectarine, white peach, red apple, lime peel and lemon bars on the nose. It's quite crisp and dry on the palate, with chalky texture and lots of citrus, from mandarin orange pith to lime juice.

title: Wolfberger 2014 Signature Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: The zesty freshness of Seville orange peel adds a wonderful dimension to the rose petal and apricot notes. Although the palate is not quite as vibrant as the nose, the lighter body and dry finish strike a great balance.

title: Dierberg 2013 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's a lot of rust and blood aromas on the nose of this wine, with pencil lead and black slate keeping up that mineral-driven sensibility. The flavors are light and earthy, with juniper laced across a strawberry-blossom core, showing a touch of black olive and crushed sage as well.

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2013 Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Rounded, rich and perfectly ripe pears are countered by spiced, candied lime peel. The two elements oppose each other equally and hold a poised, subtle balance, echoing long into the spicy finish.

title: Alex Gambal 2013 Les Picotins  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: With a good sense of structure, this bottling, formerly called Vieilles Vignes, comes from 55-year-old vines. It is textured, with some firm tannins as well as ripe plum flavors and acidity. The wine is still developing and will be better from 2016.

title: Amador Foothill Winery 2012 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This full-bodied wine has a rather light color. Aromas seem roasted and savory rather than fruity, leading to attractive spicy, meaty, almost mushroomy flavors. The texture is on the lean side, moderately tannic and quite dry.

title: Antoine Moltès & Fils 2014 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: This seems prematurely evolved with its lifted, kerosene-like whiff on the nose, but is no less pleasant for that. Ripe stone fruit melds into a slick, oily palate guided by a seam of bright, lemony freshness. The finish is dry and bright, and flavors fill the mouth long after the last sip.

title: Barnstormer 2014 Semi Dry Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: A hint of rose petal perfumes white peach and grapefruit on this elegant off-dry Riesling. The midpalate is softened by a burst of luscious apricot, while a zesty steak of lime balances a long, meandering finish.

title: Bernardus 2013 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Seared peach, ripe Gala apples, wet slate and pineapple aromas show on the nose of this very down-the-middle bottling. The palate is broad and inviting, with charred vanilla, buttered apples, an orange-rind sharpness and a solid oak framing.

title: Calavera Wines 2013 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)
description: Not your usual dark and superripe California wine, this is light in color with a brick-brown edge. It smells lightly spicy, almost like salt and pepper, and tastes dry, beefy and also a bit like raspberries and black tea. It's a great change of pace and very interesting to taste.

title: Erasmo 2010 Reserva de Caliboro Red (Maule Valley)
description: Earthy, smoky berry and cherry aromas are distinctly leathery and lightly herbal. This feels tight and bold, with cutting acidity. Flavors of toasty oak, herbal plum and black peppercorn finish long, due to blazing residual acidity. In fact, this is a sharp rendition of Erasmo that's not likely to get any more friendly than it currently is. Drink through 2025.

title: Carucci 2013 Murmur Vineyard Grenache (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Whiffs of white pepper and fresh young pine trees give nuance to the supple raspberry and wild red-berry fruit aromas on the nose of this bottling. It's light in body and texture once sipped, so throw a chill on it to enjoy the nice anise notes, juniper character and pomegranate backbone.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Reserve Green Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: Unapologetically sweet and luxuriously fruity, this wine is like a blackberry pie in a glass. It will be just the thing to serve as dessert, or to warm up a cold evening. It's full bodied, very thick and smooth in texture, and has a lingering finish like that of a Port.

title: Château Grand Boise 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: This is a fresh, strawberry-flavored wine with a crisp, dry aftertaste. An attractive tangy character gives life and brilliance. Ready to drink, it is a real apéritif wine.

title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2013 Los Vascos Grande Reserve Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: After hard-edged, herbal aromas mellow, spicy, earthy notes of blackberry rise up. This feels full and big-boned, with baked, toasty black-cherry flavors that are so fully oaked that the finish turns bitter, with a bit of mocha.

title: Dopff Au Moulin 2014 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Baked pear and sweet, baked apple make for an inviting opening. The same friendly duet plays on the off-dry palate all the way to the lingering finish. Along the way, there are highlights of zesty lemon and richer hints of honey and melon. It's simple, fun and even a little bit intriguing.

title: Dopff & Irion 2014 Cuvée René Dopff Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Sprightly, fresh Mirabelle plum mixes with headier notes of rose to present a full-fruited but fresh array of juicy, sweet pear, more plum, mandarin and tangerine. The mouthfeel has that typical Gewurztraminer oily richness but also a welcome slick of 2014 acidity.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2013 Harth Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: The subdued nose gives way on the palate to earthy apple, reminiscent of Russet, underlined by a vein of lemony acidity that brightens from the inside out. Lemony earthiness lingers on the dry finish.

title: Louis Max 2013 Vignes du Domaine  (Mercurey)
description: Light in color while full of fruit, this is a ripe and jammy wine. A good core of tannins are surrounded by ripe cherry and strawberry-flavored fruits. There is a good future for this dense wine, so drink from 2017.

title: Morgan 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: All ranges of pear show on the nose of this tasty wine, from Anjou to Bosc, poached to canned, and so forth. The palate also offers a pear-cider flavor profile, with some yellow apple peels, iodine and a sour yogurt character adding to the intrigue.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Lemon rinds, green apple skins, white flowers and a hint of pineapple guava decorate the nose of this wine from a former race car driver. It has tons of chalky mineral zing on the palate, which is crisp and light with grassy flavor and pithy grip.

title: Errazuriz 2013 Max Reserva Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Leather, cherry, plum and asphalt aromas are rustic but solid. This coastal Pinot is racy on the palate, with good overall balance. Flavors of tomato, stewed plum, cola and pepper finish with a touch of sea brine and tomato sauce.

title: Full Pull & Friends 2012 Bacchus Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Barrel spice, dried herb, toast and cherry aromas lead to tart fruit flavors that narrow toward the finish, with tart acids livening it all up. Perhaps some more time will pull it all together.

title: Gérard Bertrand 2013 Cigalus White (Aude Hauterive)
description: This Chardonnay-led blend, with 20% Viognier and 10% Sauvignon, opens with mature notes of apple peel, orange rind, toasted walnut, honeycomb and baking spice. The round, robust offers those same notes, followed by a subtle, refreshing salinity that appears on the finish.

title: Migration 2013 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Napa's Duckhorn house heads south for this ripe-style bottling that shows browned butter, vanilla, squeezed tangerine and dried pineapple on the nose. The palate is ripe and powerful, with honeysuckle, poached apple and lime-syrup flavors.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Trois Chateaux Riesling (Alsace)
description: Notes of bruised apple peel make this wine appear older than it is, but it is not without charm. The apple fruit is tied into a streak of bright, lemony freshness concluding in a just off-dry, invigorating finish.

title: Kynsi 2012 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Smoked cherries and raspberries are spiced with pencil lead, oregano and rosemary on this entry-level blend from an incredibly reliable producer. The wine is expertly balanced yet not overly showy, with red fruit midpalate and an anise spice character throughout.

title: Lachini 2012 La Bestia Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: Notes of dried cranberry, cherry, licorice and medicine cabinet predominate, with the aromas seeming somewhat advanced. The flavors are full bodied and high-octane, with the tannins needing time to stretch their legs.

title: Lagar de Bezana 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)
description: A wide-based nose blends saucy, spicy notes with louder, riper aromas of blackberry and black currant. The palate feels jammy, chunky, rubbery and tannic, while blackberry flavors are earthy, spicy and herbal prior to finishing minty, charred and tannic. Drink through 2020.
